description.narrative: MBA Polymers, Inc. (the company or MBA), is a materials recovery/recycling company in Richmond, California, USA. MBA owns and operates an engineering thermoplastic (ETP) recycling facility in Richmond and plans to construct and operate a 40,000 TPY plant in Guangzhou, China. The principal source of feedstock for this plant will be collected in and shipped from appliance, electronics, and office equipment recycling facilities in Japan. The company has requested the Environmental Opportunities Facility (EOF) of IFC to provide an equity investment of $1.2 million in the company. The proposed investment would support MBAs planned expansion into markets where costs of virgin materials are relatively high and materials take-back mechanisms have been mandated in producer countries. MBA estimates that its proprietary recovery and refining process, producing high-quality recovered materials, is a minimum of two years ahead of any competing process. MBA is providing a high-quality, market-driven product which addresses the environmental issue of ETP disposal. In those countries where take-back mechanisms have been legislated, ETP is usually burned in municipal waste incinerators or landfilled. A very small percentage is currently recovered/recycled despite its high value exceeding that of other recovered waste materials, including aluminum and PET bottles. Where 1 kilogram of virgin ETP is replaced by recovered material, 2 to 3 kilograms of CO2 is prevented from entering the atmosphere, reducing greenhouse gases.

name.narrative: The GMP plant is located in an industrial zone in the Nansha Development Area of Guangzhou, China, nearby such factories as GE Plastics largest plant in China. In addition, there is the possibility that MBA will allocate some of IFC/EOFs funds to develop a joint venture factory in an IFC eligible country in Southeastern Europe.
